results.title: The Consultation
results.creator_credit: Frances McGivern, AFTRS and Liz Crosby
results.brief_description: Betty (Leverne McDonnell) sees Larry (Matthew Crosby) across a bar. There is mutual interest, engagement, excitement, and of course, attraction. A stylish, erotic drama with a twist in the tale; a romance for the times we live in.

results.title: The Consequences of nuclear war
results.creator_credit: Ross Christopher and Australian National University
results.brief_description: Highlights of a conference, with the same name as the title, which was held at the Australian National University. The papers dealt with various aspects of the nuclear arms race and were presented by a range of Australian and international speakers.

results.title: The Conscience of a child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer, Edmond Levy, American Psychological Society and Mayar-Sklar Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on behaviour: the science of psychology”.
The ways in which psychologists are studying, in the laboratory of Dr. Robert Sears at Stanford University, the growth and development of personality and emotional behaviour in children. The roles portrayed by Eddie, his mother and father are re-enactments based on actual research and findings in Dr Sears’ experiment.

results.title: The Conquered dream
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Richard Robinson and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: A documentary history of the exciting, sometimes ill-fated exploration of Canada’s Arctic, produced jointly by the British Broadcasting Corporation and the National Film Board of Canada. The film shows the challenge and the rewards of the far north and, from rare film footage, some of the exploits of the first and last men to run the gauntlet of the cold: Byrd’s flight; Stefansson’s sled journey; Captain Bernier’s explorations; and finally, the voyage of the U.S.S. Manhattan. Commentary written and spoken by Stanley Jackson.

results.title: The Conquered desert: Libya
results.brief_description: The Libyan Arab Republic since the revolution of September 1969 has progressed in many ways. There has been a development of an infrastructure of industry and agriculture. There is education for all, cultural centres, housing and health services. In fact, total self-sufficiency has been achieved since the revolution.

results.title: The Confessional = Le Confessionnal
results.creator_credit: Cinemaginaire, Enigma Films, Cinea, Denise Robert, David Puttnam, Philippe Carcassonne and Robert Robert Lepage
results.brief_description: Past, present and the world of cinema merge in this unique and visually innovate thriller. Quebec, 1952, and the church is abuzz as master director Alfred Hitchcock (played by Ron Burrage) is in town to film “I Confess”. An equally gripping story is going on in the background - the elements echoing that of the plot, as 16 year old church worker, Rachel (Suzanne Clement), is with child to an unknown father, only a young priest knows the truth. Quebec, 1989 and Pierre (Lothaire Bluteau) returns home to attend the funeral of his father. During his stay Pierre vows to solve the mystery of the parentage of his half brother, Marc (Patrick Goyette)- Rachel’s son, a discontented rent boy and father of a young child. Pierre’s mission is not an easy one, as the secrets of the past and heredity cloud the situation and find resonance in the future. Like the plot of Hitchcock’s film, only one man holds the key to past and present that was disclosed to him in the confines of the confessional. In French with English subtitles.
